description: Change of use to the basement and ground floor from a public house (Class A4) to restaurant (Class A3) with 104 covers and associated extraction unit at rear and change of use to upper floors from self-contained flats (Class C3) to hotel (Class C1) with 19 ensuite hotel rooms.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: TP03, Oct 2015, Studio 5 Architects.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Before occupation details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority demonstrating compliance with the cycle parking / storage requirements of the London Plan (minimum 2 long stay cycle parking spaces and minimum 4 short stay spaces) to serve the hotel and restaurant.  The cycle parking spaces shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details prior to occupation.  REASON: To ensure that the development provides an appropriate balance of transport options, reduce the likelihood of traffic congestion and does not adversely affect the safety of the road network, in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13. | Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.  Reason: To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 7.15. | The hours of operation for the A3 use of the building shall be restricted to the period 08.00 - 23.00hrs Monday to Sunday including Bank Holidays.  Reason: To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing | Prior to occupation, a delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority demonstrating compliance with the DSP guidance from Transport for London and WestTrans.  REASON: To ensure that the development reduce the likelihood of traffic congestion and does not adversely affect the safety of the road network, in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable cooking extract system, including the provision of a suitable extract fan, odour control equipment, with a vertical discharge terminus without any cap or cover, at a minimum of 1.5 metres above the highest roof eaves of the building. The details shall satisfy the advice at "DEFRA, 2005: Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems". The system, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.  Reason: To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013 and policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy. | Details of the refuse storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The refuse storage shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1(e) (g) and (j) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan - Consolidated (2015) policy 5.16. | The hotel hereby approved shall achieve composite sound reduction indices of the building envelope with internal levels of not greater than 30 dB LAeq.1hr 23.00-07.00 hrs and 45 dB LAmax.1hr (fast) 23.00 -07.00 hrs will be achieved inside the guest bedrooms with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.   Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development scheme shall provide fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms with the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level prior to occupation and  shall thereafter be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
